result.execSummary:
The defendant James M. Barkley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr:
Judgment is a result of Retail Theft on 1/18/15.

Judgment is due Joint & Several with co-actor (Adam V. Kamish) per court order.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
-The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for restitution, in the amount of $941.86 payable to WalMart, Jefferson WI; this is joint and several with Co-Defendant Adam Kamish.

--The Clerk imposes the 5% restitution surcharge per the 10/1/12 Standing Order, per the 2/18/15 standing order failure to pay as ordered is 2 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence in being with Huber. If Huber is used, the defendant is ordered to report and serve the sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber without further process.

--The Clerk imposes the 10% restitution surcharge per the 10/1/12 Standing Order, per the 2/18/15 standing order failure to pay as ordered is 2 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence in being with Huber. If Huber is used, the defendant is ordered to report and serve the sentence for failure to pay with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber without further process.

--pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge= $518;  to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing thirty days after Mr. Barkley's release from the WSPS and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve six months in Jail  (to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System; consecutive to the prison system that Mr. Barkley is currently serving

Consecutive to: to the prison sentence that Mr. Barkley is currently serving

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 9:13am. 
Defendant James M. Barkley in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Mr. Barkley waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Service of Information admitted, reading waived
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Count #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Barkley to:
--serve six months in Jail  (to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System; consecutive to the prison system that Mr. Barkley is currently serving
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge= $518;  to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing thirty days after Mr. Barkley's release from the WSPS and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 10 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for restitution, in the amount of $941.86 payable to WalMart, Jefferson WI; this is joint and several with Co-Defendant Adam Kamish.
The Court determines that the Defendant has previously provided a DNA sample; therefore the Court does not impose a requirement that Mr. Barkley provide a DNA sample as to this case. 
The Court denies the Defense request that the Court allow Huber privileges on the six month jail-term period. 
Felony firearm/voting prohibiton warnings given. 
recess 9:36am.
[Post-Hearing/Off-Record:  In response to the clerk's inquiry regarding the need to set a date certain for the commencement of the payment-plan, the Court instructs the clerk to contact the prison registrar to learn of Mr. Barkley's current anticipated release date, and then to schedule the first payment on the date which is thirty days after that anticipated release date.  The Court notes that, if for some reason Mr. Barkley's incarceration is extended beyond the current anticipated release date, then Mr. Barkley may petition the Court for further extension of the payment plan start-date.]
Proposed order to produce
Defendant from Walworth County Jail for the 4/13/15 Preliminary Hearing
Proposed order to produce
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 9:06am [mo]
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek appears in Court.   ADA Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Svehlek indicates that Mr. Barkley was  to appear here today, by Writ from the Walworth Co. jail.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliace.
Atty. Svehlek requests another Preliminary Hearing date be set. Further, Atty. Svehlek requests the State prepare a Writ for Mr. Barkley's transport to Jefferson Co. for court appearance. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 9:09am 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing: 4/13/15 at 8:30am

Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 18, 2015 at 08:40 am.
Request for Detainer and fax confirmation
Conflict Review Worksheet

case called at 3:31pm. [MK]
Defendant James M. Barkley appears via videoconferncing from the Walworth County Jail. His counsel, Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek, is in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing connection is sight and sound sufficient.  
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, then-DA Wambach or attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Barkley. The Court does not recall Mr. Barkley or the cases. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Attorney Svehlek indicates that she will mail a copy of the Criminal Complaint to Mr. Barkley today.  
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Adam Kamish
--no presence at the Walmart Store in the City of Jefferson
--booking at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department is to occur the next time Mr. Barkley is transported here for a hearing 
recess 3:38pm.  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/18/15 at 8:40am (2) Preliminary Hearing on 3/30/15 at 9:00am (with Co-Defendant's Case #15CF25)
Initial appearance on March 10, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

case called at 2:14pm. [MK]
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Initial Appearance today, however Attorney Svehlek has learned that Mr. Barkley is in the Walworth County Jail. 
The Court adjourns the hearing. 
recess 2:15pm. 

NEXT:  reschedule Initial Appearance-- arrangements are to be made for Mr. Barkley to appear by v/c from the Walworth County Jail if possible
